com.konakart.al

Class ProductFetch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.konakart.al.ProductFetch

  • public class ProductFetch
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to provide options for the FetchProduct method. Default values are set for when fetching a new result set from the database.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int OP_FILTER
      Constant that defines the type of operation - Filter an existing result set with more constraints

      Constant that defines the type of operation - Fetch a new result set
      static int OP_NAVIGATE
      Constant that defines the type of operation - Navigate (page) an existing result set

      Constant that defines the type of operation - Sort an existing result set

    • Method Detail

      • getOperation

        public int getOperation()
        The type of operation. Valid values are:
        • ProductFetch.OP_GET - Fetch a new result set
        • ProductFetch.OP_NAVIGATE - Navigate (page) an existing result set
        • ProductFetch.OP_FILTER - Filter an existing result set with more constraints
        • ProductFetch.OP_SORT - Sort an existing result set
        Returns:
        the operation

      • setOperation

        public void setOperation(int operation)
        The type of operation. Valid values are:
        • ProductFetch.OP_GET - Fetch a new result set
        • ProductFetch.OP_NAVIGATE - Navigate (page) an existing result set
        • ProductFetch.OP_FILTER - Filter an existing result set with more constraints
        • ProductFetch.OP_SORT - Sort an existing result set
        Parameters:
        operation - the operation to set

      • isGetSpecials

        public boolean isGetSpecials()
        When set to true the engine is called with getSpecialsPerCategory() rather than searchForProductsWithOptions()
        Returns:
        the getSpecials

      • setGetSpecials

        public void setGetSpecials(boolean getSpecials)
        When set to true the engine is called with getSpecialsPerCategory() rather than searchForProductsWithOptions()
        Parameters:
        getSpecials - the getSpecials to set

      • isSetCustomFacets

        public boolean isSetCustomFacets()
        If true, then the customFacets retrieved from Solr are used to create a new list of currentTagGroups. When filtering products, the customFacets returned from Solr will only contain facets that contain products and this may not be the desired result. i.e. You may want to continue displaying all available facets.
        Returns:
        the setCustomFacets

      • setSetCustomFacets

        public void setSetCustomFacets(boolean setCustomFacets)
        If true, then the customFacets retrieved from Solr are used to create a new list of currentTagGroups. When filtering products, the customFacets returned from Solr will only contain facets that contain products and this may not be the desired result. i.e. You may want to continue displaying all available facets.
        Parameters:
        setCustomFacets - the setCustomFacets to set
